Company Summary

DISH, an EchoStar company, has been reimagining the future of connectivity for more than 40 years. Our business reach spans satellite television service, live-streaming and on-demand programming, smart home installation services, mobile plans and products and now we are building America’s First Smart Network™.

Today, our brands include EchoStar, Hughes, DISH TV, Sling TV, Boost Mobile and GenMobile.

Department Summary

Our Retail Wireless team, serving our Boost Mobile and GenMobile Brands, is redefining consumer expectations through new platforms, new business models and new ways of thinking. Equipped with a first-of-its-kind 5G network, a passion for change and the power to drive it, we’ll emerge as the nation’s fourth facilities-based wireless carrier and a disruptive force in the market at large.

Key Responsibilities

Job Duties and Responsibilities

In This Role, You Will

- Collect, analyze, and interpret supply chain data to identify trends and opportunities.
- Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to monitor key performance indicators (KPIs).
- Identify inefficiencies and propose solutions to enhance supply chain performance.
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams for process improvements and monitor results.
- Develop and implement inventory management strategies, including demand forecasting.
- Evaluate supplier performance, coordinate logistics activities, and analyze transportation costs for efficiency.

Skills, Experience And Requirements

As a successful Supply Chain Analyst II, you will have:

Education And Experience

- Associates degree+ or a minimum of two years of supply chain or business analytics related experience
- Professional certifications such as APICS Certified Supply Chain Professional (CSCP) or Certified in Production and Inventory Management (CPIM) is preferred

Skills And Qualifications

- Strong interpersonal, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
- Proficient in supply chain software and data analysis tools (e.g., SAP, Oracle, Excel, Tableau).
- Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
- Ability to work independently, manage work assignments, and exercise judgment.
- Proficient with Microsoft Office; flexible to changing business needs.
- Detail-oriented and able to work collaboratively; Lean Six Sigma experience preferred.
